Half-Life is one of those games that you *HAVE* to have and experience, it is the definition of thinking on your feet and shooting at the same time, with a story you can follow through easily and be amazed at how deep it can go when you research it; even though it is now "old" it doesn't lose it's grip to impress you in some way or another.
Oh yeah, this game has so many mods, that it's just, over-whelmingly fun to play them all and have a blast with it.
So yeah, get this game.

People new to the Half-Life franchise may wan't to skip this game, as it is easy to just watch a playthrough of it, or just read a summary of the story somewhere online, and many aspects of it are very outdated, especially the graphics and textures. Although playing this game isn't a requirement, it is still a very good game, and I would still recommend it.

Here are some reasons you should play it:
[olist]
[*] It's a great, 10-20 hour experience.
[*] It's low price.
[*] Although the graphics are outdated, the designs of the enemies and NPCs are still pretty good.
[*] It has nice selection of weapons that you discover along the way.
[*] It has very satisfying gunplay.
[*] It has a good story.
[*] It has fairly well-designed puzzles.
[*] It has a great soundtrack.
[*] It has great sound-design.
[*] It's fun to speedrun (for those interested).
[/olist]
Play it, you won't regret it.

In my opinion Half-life 1 is like a 6/10. I found this game pretty boring. the campaign is average. Each enemy felt the same. I also do not understand how Gordon is considered a good protagonist, even though he does not speak and is considered a good guy even though you could kill scientist's and security guards, you know your allies. The multiplayer was slightly below average but also not many people where on the servers. HL1's multiplayer is slightly different than HL2DM(new game but still has the arena elements) and OpFor(which was very similar but had more weapon variety but the maps where still shit) 

this is just my opinion, I know i have a very unpopular opinion. I know almost everyone will comment saying my opinion is wrong or something else.  But thank you for reading my post.

Here is a pros and cons list in my opinion

Pros
The soundtrack
The weapon design 

Cons
The multiplayer 
The enemy placements
VENTS 
Platforming



Neutral things 
The story

Take Quake's stellar movement and its engine, add a near seamless narrative containing subtle morality choices and questioning from beginning to end, make the combat encounters moreso strategic than skill based and that's Half Life. While the majority of the game is stellar, memorable and fun to play through, chapters like Surface tension, Interloper and Nihalanth substantially sour the experience, especially on the hardest difficulty.

Suit up as Gordon Freeman, a silent doctor who has to make his way through the alien-infested Black Mesa facility and has to fight his way through various enemies. The gameplay is simple without too many gimmicks, but a fun experience nevertheless.
